subject: History
title: Gregor Mendel: The Forgotten Monk
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Gregor Mendel: The Forgotten Monk.

hook.text: A monk spent eight years crossing pea plants in a garden. Nobody cared. His work founded modern genetics.

buildup.text: Gregor Mendel grew over 28,000 pea plants in an Austrian monastery, tracking traits like color and height.

discovery.text: He found that traits follow predictable ratiosâ€”dominant and recessiveâ€”passed from parent to offspring in clear patterns.

twist.text: He published his findings in 1866. The scientific world ignored him completely. He died unknown in 1884.

climax.text: In 1900, three scientists independently rediscovered his laws. Mendel was finally recognized as the father of genetics.

punchline.text: The father of genetics died before anyone noticed.

quiz.question: Why was Mendel's groundbreaking work on genetics ignored during his lifetime?
options: The Catholic Church censored his findings
The scientific community simply overlooked his 1866 publication
His experiments were proven wrong by other botanists
